abstract.p: ABC's Nightline will broadcast three-part series on rap music industry (S)

block.p: ABC's ''Nightline'' is venturing into uncharted territory.
Next wednesday it begins a three-part series on the rap music industry, a decidedly young and hip topic for the late-night news program.m.
ABC's ''Nightline'' is venturing into uncharted territory.
Next wednesday it begins a three-part series on the rap music industry, a decidedly young and hip topic for the late-night news program.m.
Robert Krulwich, an ABC News correspondent on the series, said one hope was that it would lure younger people, who tend to watch less news than their elders.
But, he said, he thought it was an important topic that has been somewhat neglected by major news organizations in general.

''This is a culture that has remained somewhat under the radar,'' he said. ''You hear the noise of it. You smell the violence of it, and that's pretty much all you notice -- other than the fact that kids are spending long, long periods of time in their rooms listening to it.''
